subject: Photography
title: What Is Color Grading?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: What Is Color Grading?.

hook.text: The Matrix is green. Mad Max is orange and teal. Color grading transforms a good image into a mood.

buildup.text: Color grading is the process of adjusting colors in post-production to create a specific look or atmosphere.

discovery.text: Unlike color correction, which fixes errors, color grading adds artistic intent. It's painting with existing pixels.

twist.text: Over-grading kills images. Heavy tints, crushed blacks, and unnatural tones scream 'filter' rather than 'art.'

climax.text: The best color grading is invisible. The viewer feels the mood without noticing the technique.

punchline.text: Color grading: the art of changing how a photo feels.

quiz.question: How does color grading differ from color correction?
options: Color grading adds artistic intent while correction fixes technical errors
Color grading is always done before correction
